item.title: Report E-2024090301
item.description:
Report E-2024090301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: OSCEOLA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 27000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJB experienced a customer location and roadside release of UN1819 Xcelerator A38 from a 300-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 110-gallons of product released to a 53' x 8' area of the trailer floor, 54' x 8' area of the asphalt roadway, a 54' x 2.5' area of the soil shoulder, and a 30' x 40' area of the customerâ€™s asphalt lot as well as into a storm drain catch basin. Contractors secured the release with absorbents, pads, and boom upon arrival. The crew confirmed the tote was punctured due to improper loading. The material still in the damaged tote was transferred into a new one. Once all free liquid was absorbed, sodium bicarbonate and water were used to rinse the impacted areas to clean and neutralize them. The following day, the crew returned to site with a vac truck and a pressure washer. The impacted catch basin was vacuumed and flushed out. The customer confirmed the pumps were shut off so the material could not migrate from the drains catch basin. The impacted concrete lot at the customers location and the impacted asphalt roadway were then pressure washed, and all material was collected into a vac-truck. Approximately 1300-gallons of impacted wastewater were removed from site pending disposal. (5) 55-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents, the cut up damaged poly tote, and impacted debris were transported to the XPO Terminal located in Jonesboro, AR for terminal personnel to manage. The impacted soil shoulder was then secured and marked for future remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024090843
item.description:
Report X-2024090843

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Car was reported leaking from the top by a carman. Upon arrival, seven of eight manway swing bolts were less than tool tight and easily turned by hand. The gasket was inspected and found to be in good condition with no issues. The gasket was reinstalled, the manway properly secured, sealed, and wiped down. The car was released back into transportation.
